abstract.p: Hyundai Engineering and Construction requests emergency loans from creditors; owes $117 million due today; fears of bankruptcy grow (S)

block.p: A subsidiary of Hyundai, South Korea's largest conglomerate, requested emergency loans from creditors today, raising concern that another big bankruptcy was in the making, a year after Daewoo collapsed under debts now estimated at $80 billion. The subsidiary, Hyundai Engineering and Construction, needs $161 million to repay short-term debt to nonbank creditors, including nearly $117 million due today. The subsidiary's debts totaled about $5.7 billion at the end of 1999, half of that due this year. Earlier this week, Hyundai Engineering was a day late in paying its 19,000 employees, and banks agreed to extend some debt maturities.
